in.tosc.doandroidlib

Class DigitalOcean

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.tosc.doandroidlib.DigitalOcean

  • public class DigitalOcean
extends java.lang.Object
    The main entry point for the Library First you need to initialise it using init(String clientId, String callbackUrl) (The clientId and callbackUrl are what you get when you register an app on Digital Oceal developer dashboard) You should use one of the following -
    • Use the static doLogin(Activity) to login the user and get token
    • Use the static getDOClient(String) to get a client
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    championswimmer

      • doLogin

        public static void doLogin(android.app.Activity act)
        This starts the login process (in a Chrome custom tab). We use LOGIN_ACT_INTENT_CODE to do a Activity.startActivityForResult(Intent, int)
        Parameters:
        act - An activity object, usually this if doing this from Activity.onCreate(Bundle)

      • onLoggedIn

        public static void onLoggedIn(java.lang.String token)
        You do not need to directly use the function ever. We use this to set the Oauth Token globally.
        Parameters:
        token - : The auth token you receive from the Chrome Custom Tab for login

      • getDOClient

        public static DigitalOceanClient getDOClient(@NonNull
                                             java.lang.String authToken)
        Get a Digital Ocean v2 API client. For available methods, see DigitalOceanClient
        Parameters:
        authToken - The auth token (which you probably should have saved in SharedPreferences)
        Returns:
